translated: it is said that the unsurpassed enlightenment that exists in all sentient beings is not recognized as existing.

analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas gnas la nges pa mi bya /

analyzed: de ru zhen par mi byed pas //
translated: Since there is no attachment to that,

original: gang yang de ru yid kyis spongs shes na //
analyzed: gang yang de ru yid kyis spongs shes na //
translated: it is said that “the mind should be abandoned in that regard.”

original: de ltar shes na sems can du blta bar mi bya /
analyzed: de ltar shes na sems can du blta bar mi bya /

analyzed: khams gsum ma lus pa 'di dag lta bar 'gyur ba med pa la rgyun du gnas pa'i byang chub yin pas /

original: ma lus rgyun du byang chub rtogs pas na //
analyzed: ma lus rgyun du byang chub rtogs pas na //
translated: Since it is realized that the entire universe is continuously enlightened,

original: de ltar rtogs na dogs pa dang re ba mi bya /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs na dogs pa dang re ba mi bya /
translated: if one understands it in that way, one should not have doubts or hopes.

analyzed: @104a * // mya ngan las 'das par lhung ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa dran med de yang dngos por ma grub bas /

original: 'khor ba gang yin mya ngan 'das pa gang //
analyzed: 'khor ba gang yin mya ngan 'das pa gang //
translated: What is samsara? What is nirvana?

analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni yid kyi dri ma yin gyis /
translated: Samsara and nirvana are mental stains.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag na chos thams cad kyi lhan cig skyes pa yin pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag na chos thams cad kyi lhan cig skyes pa yin pas /
translated: If they are naturally pure, they are the connate state of all phenomena.

original: yid kyi dri ma dag na lhan cig skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi dri ma dag na lhan cig skyes pa ste /
translated: If the mental stains are purified, they are connate.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin shin du rnam par dag pa yin pas /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin shin du rnam par dag pa yin pas /
translated: Since the nature that is connate with mind is utterly pure,

analyzed: gnyen po ma lus pa rdzogs pa la glo bur gyi mi mthun pas glags mi rnyed pas /
translated: the remedy is complete in every respect, and adventitious discordant factors cannot find an opportunity.

original: de'i tshe mi mthun phyogs kyi 'jug pa med pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi mthun phyogs kyi 'jug pa med pa /

analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa la yang nyon mongs pa'i dran pa skye yin gda' zer na /

original: ma rtogs pa'i so so'i skye bos ni dran pa'i rnam par smin pas /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i so so'i skye bos ni dran pa'i rnam par smin pas /
translated: Since the ripening of memory arises in an ordinary being who has not realized [connateness],

original: 'khor ba'i bde sdug bsags la /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bde sdug bsags la /
translated: the happiness and suffering of samsara are accumulated.

original: rang gis rang la gnod pa byas so //
analyzed: rang gis rang la gnod pa byas so //
translated: One harms oneself.

analyzed: dper na mi mkhas ba'i ngang tshul can chu srin kum bhi ra mtsho nang na gnas pas /
translated: For example, a kumbhira crocodile, which has an unskilled nature, lives in the ocean.

original: nam mkha' la bya rgyu ba'i grib ma mthong nas bya yin snyam nas bsnyags pas /
analyzed: nam mkha' la bya rgyu ba'i grib ma mthong nas bya yin snyam nas bsnyags pas /
translated: Seeing the shadow of a bird flying in the sky, it thinks, ‘It’s a bird!’ and chases after it.

original: rang gis rang la ngal bar byed do //
analyzed: rang gis rang la ngal bar byed do //
translated: It tires itself out.

analyzed: mkhas pa'i ngang tshul can chu srin ma ka ras ni bya'i grib ma mthong yang chu rang du shes pas snyegs par mi byed pas ngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The makara, seeing the shadow of a bird, knows that it is water and does not pursue it, so it does not tire.

translated: In the same way, ordinary beings who have not realized [the nature of mind] tire themselves out in the ultimate by pursuing the stains of the mind with the effort of mindfulness.

translated: In the same way, yogins and yoginīs who have realized [the nature of mind] do not pursue the stains of the mind by meditating on the mind with the knowledge that the stains of the mind are the mind itself.

original: sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they do not become weary.

original: 'di nyid kyis gsal bar byed pas /🔽ji ltar rgya mtsho dang bar gyur pa la //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis gsal bar byed pas / ji ltar rgya mtsho dang bar gyur pa la //

analyzed: mtsho shin tu dang bar gyur pa de la rde'u bsgyur bas chu bur byung bas chu kho na yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way, the very clear ocean is not disturbed by the bubbles that arise from throwing stones into it.

analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i sems shin du dang ba la glo bur du dran pa byung yang snying po med pa khong stong gis /

original: snang stong du glo bur bar shes pas /
analyzed: snang stong du glo bur bar shes pas /
translated: Since he knows that the empty appearance is adventitious,

analyzed: chu bur chu nyid yin te de bzhin thim par 'gyur //
translated: the water bubble is water itself, and so it dissolves.

analyzed: de ltar dran las ma yengs pa'i dus su sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: Thus, when one is not distracted from mindfulness, one is a buddha.

original: dran pa byung ba'i dus su sems can yin pas /
analyzed: dran pa byung ba'i dus su sems can yin pas /
translated: When mindfulness arises, one is a sentient being.

analyzed: dri ma med pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: the nature of the stainless mind

original: sems can ma lus ba de ltar rtogs su rung ba la /

translated: is suitable for all sentient beings to realize in that way.

original: rang la yod pa rtogs med la brten par 'os pas /

analyzed: ma lus mi rtog pa ru brten par 'os //

analyzed: bsgom dang sgom byed gnyis su med par rtogs na /

analyzed: gang bsgoms yongs su bsgom pa gang //

original: 'di ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgom pa'o //

original: 'di yis bsgoms pa'o zhes /
analyzed: 'di yis bsgoms pa'o zhes /

analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir bgyi bas sems can 'ching //

original: chos nyid la bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba ma mchis pas /
analyzed: chos nyid la bdag dang bdag gir bgyi ba ma mchis pas /
translated: Since there is no appropriation of self and what belongs to self in reality,

original: dbye ba de nyid 'ching dang bral bar bya //
analyzed: dbye ba de nyid 'ching dang bral bar bya //
translated: that distinction itself is bondage and freedom.

original: bdag nyid grol ba ni skye ba med pa /
analyzed: bdag nyid grol ba ni skye ba med pa /
translated: If one realizes that the liberated self is nonarising

analyzed: bsam du med par rtogs na /

analyzed: bdag gi don du sangs rgyas pa yin pas /
translated: since one is awakened for one’s own benefit,

analyzed: ma lus rgyun du gnas pa'i sangs rgyas te //

analyzed: sems nyid skye ba la sogs pa gang yang med / sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas /

analyzed: dper na snod mang gi nang du chus gang ba la zla ba'i gzugs brnyan shar ba bzhin du /

analyzed: snying rje mi rtogs gzhan phan 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: compassion is nonconceptual, while the benefit for others is the result.

original: de la chos skul ni ming yang med na /
analyzed: de la chos skul ni ming yang med na /
translated: If the dharmakāya does not even have a name,

original: gzugs sku gnyis kyi 'byung sa yin pas /
analyzed: gzugs sku gnyis kyi 'byung sa yin pas /
translated: it is the source of the two rūpakāyas.

original: ming ni mchog tu gzhan la phan po'o //
analyzed: ming ni mchog tu gzhan la phan po'o //
translated: The name is the supreme benefit for others.

original: de la blo'i yul las 'das pa don dam bstod pa nyid ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de la blo'i yul las 'das pa don dam bstod pa nyid ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The ultimate praise that transcends the domain of the intellect is the dharmakāya.

original: de la me tog rgyas pa ni //
analyzed: de la me tog rgyas pa ni //
translated: The blooming of the flowers

original: longs sku yin pas /
analyzed: longs sku yin pas /
translated: is the saṃbhogakāya.

original: stong pa'i sdong bo dam pa me tog rgyas //
analyzed: stong pa'i sdong bo dam pa me tog rgyas //
translated: The supreme trunk of emptiness blooms with flowers.

original: de yang 'gro ba'i rang gi rnam rtog gis rang la byas pas mthong ba sna tshogs dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba'i rang gi rnam rtog gis rang la byas pas mthong ba sna tshogs dang ldan pas /
translated: Moreover, since one’s own concepts are created by migrating beings, they possess various visions.

original: snying rje rnam pa sna tshogs du mar ldan //
analyzed: snying rje rnam pa sna tshogs du mar ldan //
translated: They possess various kinds of compassion.

original: 'bad pa las byung ba ma yin lhun grub yin /
analyzed: 'bad pa las byung ba ma yin lhun grub yin /
translated: They are not produced by effort; they are spontaneously present.

original: snga ma ma dran pa rgyu yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ma dran pa rgyu yin la /
translated: The nonmemory of the former is the cause.

original: phyi ma ma dran pas 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: phyi ma ma dran pas 'bras bu yin /
translated: The nonmemory of the latter is the result.

original: snga ma dran ba rgyu yin la /
analyzed: snga ma dran ba rgyu yin la /
translated: The memory of the former is the cause.

original: phyi ma ma skyes pa 'bras bu yin /
analyzed: phyi ma ma skyes pa 'bras bu yin /
translated: The nonarising of the latter is the result.

original: snga ma ma skyes ba rgyu yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ma skyes ba rgyu yin la /
translated: The nonarising of the former is the cause.

original: phyi ma blo las 'das pa 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: phyi ma blo las 'das pa 'bras bu yin //
translated: The transcendence of the intellect of the latter is the result.

original: de dag 'bad pa bya mi dgos bas /
analyzed: de dag 'bad pa bya mi dgos bas /
translated: Since those do not require effort,

original: lhun gyis grub pa phyi ma'i 'bras du ste //
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa phyi ma'i 'bras du ste //
translated: The spontaneous accomplishment is the later result.

original: 'bad rtsol dang bral ba blo'i yul las 'das pa de nyid sems kyi ming med de /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol dang bral ba blo'i yul las 'das pa de nyid sems kyi ming med de /
translated: Free from effort and beyond the realm of the intellect, that is the nameless mind.

original: sems tsam pa la sogs ba gzhan gyi sems su khas blangs kyang ma yin pas /
analyzed: sems tsam pa la sogs ba gzhan gyi sems su khas blangs kyang ma yin pas /
translated: Although others, such as the Cittamātra, assert it to be the mind, it is not.

original: bde ba 'di ni gzhan pa'i sems yin no //
analyzed: bde ba 'di ni gzhan pa'i sems yin no //
translated: This bliss is not the mind of another.

original: de'i phyir blo las 'das pa'i don dam pa'i stong pa nyid la ni @105b gzugs sku gnyis yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo las 'das pa'i don dam pa'i stong pa nyid la ni @105b gzugs sku gnyis yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate emptiness that is beyond the intellect, the two form kāyas do not exist.

original: stong pa'i sdong po dam pa snying rje min //
analyzed: stong pa'i sdong po dam pa snying rje min //
translated: The supreme trunk of emptiness is not compassion.

original: de lta bu'i chos nyid zab mo la rtsa ba sems nyid dam /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos nyid zab mo la rtsa ba sems nyid dam /
translated: In that profound dharmatā, there is no root of mind,

original: sdong po sems sam lo 'dab sems las byung ba med pas /
analyzed: sdong po sems sam lo 'dab sems las byung ba med pas /
translated: no trunk of mind, and no leaves that arise from the mind.

original: gang yang slar rtsa ba lo 'dab med /
analyzed: gang yang slar rtsa ba lo 'dab med /
translated: There is nothing at all that is a root or leaves.

original: de la blo dang rig pas dmigs su med de /
analyzed: de la blo dang rig pas dmigs su med de /
translated: The mind and vidyā cannot be observed there.

original: de la blo dang rig pas dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la blo dang rig pas dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind and vidyā can be observed there,

original: de la dmigs par byed pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de la dmigs par byed pa gang yin pa /
translated: whatever observes that

original: bsgom du med pa'i dbyings yin pas //
analyzed: bsgom du med pa'i dbyings yin pas //
translated: is the nonmeditated dhātu.

original: bsgoms na longs sku sprul sku mtshang bas /
analyzed: bsgoms na longs sku sprul sku mtshang bas /
translated: If one meditates, the nirmāṇakāya and saṃbhogakāya are faults.

original: der lhung bas ni yan lag chag par 'gyur //🔽blo las 'das shing skye ba med pa de las dran pa dang ma dran pa byung yang /
analyzed: der lhung bas ni yan lag chag par 'gyur // blo las 'das shing skye ba med pa de las dran pa dang ma dran pa byung yang /
translated: Since one falls into those, the branch is broken.🔽That unborn state that is beyond the mind is the unborn nature of mind,

original: sems nyid ma skyes pa yin /
analyzed: sems nyid ma skyes pa yin /
translated: whether there is mindfulness or not.

original: de las 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gnyis su snang /
analyzed: de las 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gnyis su snang /
translated: From that, saṃsāra and nirvāṇa appear as two.

original: sa bon gcig las sdong po gnyis //
analyzed: sa bon gcig las sdong po gnyis //
translated: Two trunks arise from a single seed.

original: chos sku blo las 'das pa de ni 'bras bu tha dad pa med pas /🔽rgyu mtshan de las 'bras bu gcig / de yang 'khor ba'i rgyu yang de yin la /
analyzed: chos sku blo las 'das pa de ni 'bras bu tha dad pa med pas / rgyu mtshan de las 'bras bu gcig / de yang 'khor ba'i rgyu yang de yin la /
translated: Since the dharmakāya, which is beyond the mind, is not a different result,🔽from that reason, there is a single result.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yang de yin pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu yang de yin pas /
translated: Moreover, since that is the cause of saṃsāra and the cause of nirvāṇa,

original: de yang dbyer med gang sems pa //
analyzed: de yang dbyer med gang sems pa //
translated: that is also indivisible.

original: rnal 'byor pa thams 'khor ba'i phyogs gcig pa las grol bar mthong /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa thams 'khor ba'i phyogs gcig pa las grol bar mthong /
translated: The view of all yogins is that one is liberated from the side of saṃsāra.

original: 'bring pos mya ngan las 'das pa tsam las grol bar mthong /
analyzed: 'bring pos mya ngan las 'das pa tsam las grol bar mthong /
translated: The middling view is that one is liberated from mere nirvāṇa.

original: rnal 'byor pa rab kyi dgongs pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rab kyi dgongs pa ni /
translated: The transcendent state of the best yogins

original: 'khor ba la gnas pa'i sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'dor mi len /
analyzed: 'khor ba la gnas pa'i sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang mi 'dor mi len /
translated: They neither reject nor grasp at the thoughts that arise from the mind that abides in saṃsāra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa yang mi 'dor mi len pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa yang mi 'dor mi len pas /
translated: They neither reject nor grasp at the mind that abides in the sameness of nirvāṇa.

original: 'khor ba'i dngos po med pas dogs pa med //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dngos po med pas dogs pa med //
translated: Since there are no things in saṃsāra, there is no fear.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang dngos por ma grub pa re ba mi byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de yang dngos por ma grub pa re ba mi byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Since nirvāṇa is not established as a thing, there is no hope. This is the suchness of yogins and yoginīs.

original: des ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnams grol /
analyzed: des ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnams grol /
translated: By this, they are liberated from saṃsāra and nirvāṇa.

original: gal te so so'i skye bo'i sems kyis /
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo'i sems kyis /
translated: If the mind of an ordinary being

original: sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pas re ba dang bcas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pas re ba dang bcas pa de'i tshe /
translated: hopes to attain buddhahood, it is accompanied by hope.

original: yang dag pa'i don dang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don dang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, it will not encounter the perfect meaning.

original: gang gi tshe gang dang yang ma phrad pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i don dam ba dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang dang yang ma phrad pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i don dam ba dang phrad pa'o //
translated: When it does not encounter anything at all, at that time it encounters the perfect meaning, the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo ni chos kyi sku dang phrad par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir so so'i skye bo ni chos kyi sku dang phrad par 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, since ordinary beings wish to encounter the dharmakāya,

original: gang zhig 'dod pa @106a * //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa @106a * //
translated: what is it that they wish for?

original: can gyi skye bo 'ongs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: can gyi skye bo 'ongs pa'i tshe /
translated: When a person of the world comes,

original: gal te so so'i skye bo des chos sku de la re ba med nas sems chos kyi sku la grol bar shes nas ni /
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo des chos sku de la re ba med nas sems chos kyi sku la grol bar shes nas ni /
translated: if that ordinary person, not hoping for that dharmakāya, knows that the mind is liberated in the dharmakāya,

original: de ni re ba med nas gal te 'gro na ni //
analyzed: de ni re ba med nas gal te 'gro na ni //
translated: if he goes without hope,

original: re ba med pa de ni 'jig rten pas bor ba'o //
analyzed: re ba med pa de ni 'jig rten pas bor ba'o //
translated: that one without hope is abandoned by the world.

original: gang bor ba de ni rnal 'byor pas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang bor ba de ni rnal 'byor pas blangs pa'o //
translated: That which is abandoned is taken up by the yogi.

original: 'jig rten pas blo dang sems dang yid dang rig pas blang ba gang yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas blo dang sems dang yid dang rig pas blang ba gang yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When that which is taken up by the mind, thought, and cognition of the world is abandoned,

original: bor ba blo'i yul ma yin bla ma dam pa'i brda'i man ngag gis blang bas /
analyzed: bor ba blo'i yul ma yin bla ma dam pa'i brda'i man ngag gis blang bas /
translated: since it is taken up by the intimate instruction of the sign of the sublime guru,

original: phyir sgor bor ba'i kham phor blangs nas su //
analyzed: phyir sgor bor ba'i kham phor blangs nas su //
translated: it is like taking up a discarded bowl in the street.

original: rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems kyi khyim thab dran pa 'di la don du ma bzung bas bor ba dang 'dra la /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas sems kyi khyim thab dran pa 'di la don du ma bzung bas bor ba dang 'dra la /
translated: The yogi of realization does not hold this mindfulness of the mind’s spouse as meaningful, so it is like an abandonment.

original: chos sku blo las 'das pa de nyid rtogs nas gzhan la re ba mi byed par bsdad pa rung /
analyzed: chos sku blo las 'das pa de nyid rtogs nas gzhan la re ba mi byed par bsdad pa rung /
translated: Having realized that dharmakāya is beyond the mind, it is suitable to remain without hope for another.

original: de las khyim thab bor nas bsdad pa rung //
analyzed: de las khyim thab bor nas bsdad pa rung //
translated: It is suitable to remain after abandoning the spouse.

original: chos sku blo las 'das pa ni gzugs sku rnam pa gnyis bya'o snyam pa'i sems dang ye shes mi mnga'o //
analyzed: chos sku blo las 'das pa ni gzugs sku rnam pa gnyis bya'o snyam pa'i sems dang ye shes mi mnga'o //
translated: The dharmakāya, which is beyond the mind, does not possess the mind and gnosis that thinks, “I will create the two form kāyas.”

original: rig pa'i ye shes mi mnga' yang dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pas 'gro don mdzad pa med pa de /
analyzed: rig pa'i ye shes mi mnga' yang dpag bsam gyi shing la sogs pas 'gro don mdzad pa med pa de /
translated: Although it does not possess the gnosis of vidyā, it does not benefit migrating beings with wish-fulfilling trees, and so on.

original: byas pa ltar snang ba rang rang gi rnam rtog yin pas /
analyzed: byas pa ltar snang ba rang rang gi rnam rtog yin pas /
translated: That is the individual’s conceptualization of the appearance of activity.

original: gzhan la phan pa'i don ni mi byed la //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i don ni mi byed la //
translated: It does not benefit others.

original: 'dod pa po ni phyi'i yul dang nang gi yul gnyis la so so'i skye bo sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa po ni phyi'i yul dang nang gi yul gnyis la so so'i skye bo sangs rgyas thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who desires is the desire of the ordinary being to attain buddhahood in both the external field and the internal field.

original: de dag gis chos kyi sku ma rtogs pas /
analyzed: de dag gis chos kyi sku ma rtogs pas /
translated: Since they do not understand the dharmakāya,

original: 'dod pa po la sbyin pa mi ster ba //
analyzed: 'dod pa po la sbyin pa mi ster ba //
translated: the one who desires is not given the gift.

original: rgyu 'khor ba las 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa don dam par ma grub pas /
analyzed: rgyu 'khor ba las 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa don dam par ma grub pas /
translated: Since the result, nirvāṇa, is not ultimately established from the cause, saṃsāra,

original: 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu gang yin lo //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu gang yin lo //
translated: what is the result of saṃsāra?

original: rgyu sems can la 'bras bu sangs rgyas su 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu sems can la 'bras bu sangs rgyas su 'dod pa ni /
translated: The assertion that the result, buddhahood, is in the sentient being, the cause,

original: bdag tu lta ba rgyun gyis 'dod pas /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba rgyun gyis 'dod pas /
translated: is the assertion of the continuum of the view of a self.

original: de bas bdag nyid bor bar byas na rung //
analyzed: de bas bdag nyid bor bar byas na rung //
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to abandon the self.

original: gnyug ma rnal ma lhan cig skyes pa ma bral bas rnal 'byor /
analyzed: gnyug ma rnal ma lhan cig skyes pa ma bral bas rnal 'byor /
translated: Since the innate, natural, coemergent is inseparable, it is yoga.🔽Since it has power over the transcendent state of the sugatas of the three times, it is mahasukha.

original: dus gsum gyi bde bar gshegs pa'i dgongs pa la dbang bsgyur bas dbang phyug phyag rgya chen po khong du chud pas chen mo /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi bde bar gshegs pa'i dgongs pa la dbang bsgyur bas dbang phyug phyag rgya chen po khong du chud pas chen mo /
translated: Since it is the great seal, it is mahamudra.

original: chos rnams gnyis su med pas dpal /
analyzed: chos rnams gnyis su med pas dpal /
translated: Since phenomena are nondual, it is sri.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i mda' mkhan mo blangs pas sa ra ha /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i mda' mkhan mo blangs pas sa ra ha /
translated: Since it is taken up by the archer who realizes that, it is Saraha.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang @106b rnal 'byor pa las zhal nas zhal du brgyud pas zhal snga nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang @106b rnal 'byor pa las zhal nas zhal du brgyud pas zhal snga nas /
translated: Since it is the lineage from mouth to mouth of buddhas, bodhisattvas, and yoginis, it is vakcharana.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su snying po'i don la mos pa'i don du mdzad pas /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su snying po'i don la mos pa'i don du mdzad pas /
translated: Since it is composed for the purpose of those who aspire to the meaning of the essence in the future, it is doha.

original: gnyis pa ma lus pa 'joms pa dang / brjod du med pa'i don rtogs pas do ha /
analyzed: gnyis pa ma lus pa 'joms pa dang / brjod du med pa'i don rtogs pas do ha /
translated: Since it destroys all without exception and realizes the meaning of the inexpressible, it is doha.

original: rgya rnam pa bdun gyis btab pas ko sha /
analyzed: rgya rnam pa bdun gyis btab pas ko sha /
translated: Since it is sealed with the seven seals, it is kosha.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos nyid kyi don du ma gur du bzhengs pa'i glu /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos nyid kyi don du ma gur du bzhengs pa'i glu /
translated: Since it is a song of realization of the meaning of the immovable dharmata, it is ma.

original: 'di dpe don ma lus par bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'di dpe don ma lus par bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the teaching of the entire example and meaning.

original: // / dus gsum bde gshegs rnams kyi dgongs pa mtshungs pa med pa la //
analyzed: // / dus gsum bde gshegs rnams kyi dgongs pa mtshungs pa med pa la //
translated: The intention of the sugatas of the three times is without equal.

original: dpal ldan ri khrod pa yi dgongs pa nam mkha' nyid dang mtshungs//
analyzed: dpal ldan ri khrod pa yi dgongs pa nam mkha' nyid dang mtshungs//
translated: The intention of the glorious hermit is the same as space.

original: gnyis med aa wa dh'u t'i'i dran pa 'ja' tshon 'dra ba des //
analyzed: gnyis med aa wa dh'u t'i'i dran pa 'ja' tshon 'dra ba des //
translated: The nondual memory of the avadhūti is like a rainbow.

original: do ha ko sha'i don 'grel bris pas gong nas bzod par bzhes //
analyzed: do ha ko sha'i don 'grel bris pas gong nas bzod par bzhes //
translated: Since I wrote this commentary on the meaning of the Treasury of Doha Songs, please forgive me, O guru.

original: snying gi padmo'i dkyil na gnas pa'i snying po'i don 'di ni //
analyzed: snying gi padmo'i dkyil na gnas pa'i snying po'i don 'di ni //
translated: This meaning of the essence that exists in the center of the lotus of the heart

original: slob ma snying dang 'dra ba'i ngag gi nan gyis zhus nas su //
analyzed: slob ma snying dang 'dra ba'i ngag gi nan gyis zhus nas su //
translated: was requested by the disciple who is like my heart.

original: 'di la mos pa rnams kyi don du bdag gis 'di bsgyur bas //
analyzed: 'di la mos pa rnams kyi don du bdag gis 'di bsgyur bas //
translated: I translated this for the benefit of those who have devotion.

original: sems can ma lus snying po'i don 'di rtogs nas grol gyur cig na mo ai+thim:/
analyzed: sems can ma lus snying po'i don 'di rtogs nas grol gyur cig na mo ai+thim:/
translated: May all sentient beings be liberated by realizing this meaning of the essence.
